name: Moroccan Beef and Lentil Stew
author: Kim
summary: A flavorful beef and lentil stew inspired by the tastes of Morocco. Great served over rice.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds chuck roast, cut into 1-inch cubes
½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
directions: Heat oil over medium heat in a Dutch oven
Add carrots, celery, and onion; cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes
Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute
Sprinkle salt, turmeric, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, cinnamon, ginger, cumin, coriander, and allspice over beef and vegetables
Continue to cook mixture until beef is browned, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes
Stir in tomato paste until well combined and cook for 1 minute
Add in beef broth, molasses, and bay leaves
Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until beef is tender, about 50 minutes
Mix in lentils and dried apricots
Bring stew back to a simmer
Cover and continue to cook on low, stirring occasionally, until lentils soften, about 15 minutes
Adjust salt and pepper to taste, and mix in fresh lemon juice to taste just before serving
